description: From French orogénie, from Ancient Greek ὄρος (óros, “mountain, high ground”) + γενεια (geneia, “creation, birth, making”). Surface etymology is oro- +‎ -geny.

entries.meaning: (geology) The process of mountain building by the upward folding of the Earth's crust.
examples: The effects of Acadian orogeny are concentrated in central Newfoundland, decreasing in intensity to the east and west (Williams, this volume).
